text: <@U243UT96G|mo> has joined the channel
Gidge reviewed the test plan with Patrick and had the following feedback:

* Would like to identify a handful of specific areas where app can solve a problem or enhance the experience
* Want to be mindful of "keep it simple" directive, but do want to push for unique, impactful moments
* Patrick can take those ideas and share them with facilitors and leads to get feedback
* Okay with exploration with Beacons if effective, low-cost
* Want to de-prioritize on-boarding experience, at least for pilot, until we have a chance to actually dig into ways we can help. For pilot, facilitators can just pass out devices with some simple instructions and try some things
* Keep in mind, not likely to have Cubby in all BrandLabs anytime soon, so try not to think of that for the baseline experience
I’m planning to set-up a meeting prior to our 11 on Thursday for us to review internally and coordinate messaging. In the meantime, please start the discussion here

Saw that email from Gidge. 

My reading of this doesn’t change the overarching test plan much IMHO. Yes - they’ve asked us to push in different directions, but I don’t think anything in the broad sense shifts a ton. 

My questions: 
• What are our thoughts on the areas they’ve brought up above? 
• What are the specific action items for Thursday’s meeting?

I’ll defer to others thoughts, but my interpretation is that for the call  it may be advantageous to 1.) Review our hypothesis around the problem statements (<https://docs.google.com/document/d/1AIeJCNDyhTBFuW3auJg2xl8GYr9y1wJa-oF72XdYQ_c/edit?usp=sharing>) and how a camera as an input method is “simple”, but can produce unique, impactful moments for users at the end of the day. 2.) Review the Test Plan (with special emphasis on the prototypes we need and that we may need Google help to carry out some of the testing 3.) Discuss scope re: on-boarding and in-session photo curation (make sure they don’t want those in the test and discuss that decision) 4.) Review SOW, discussed edits and timeline for moving forward
<@U0B9N0HF0|rob> shared a file: <https://uncorked.slack.com/files/james/F0ES01EHK/brandlabmobilekickoffsynthesis|BrandLab Mobile Kickoff Synthesis>

Just checking in here from the airport. I'm not sure what's been discussed here, but I wonder if it'd be worthwhile to revisit our concept doc with them as it answers a lot of what gidge seems to be asking.
:thumbsup:
Agreed! Thanks Justin

<@U0260V4K1> <@U0B9N0HF0> <@U0265G76F> The one red flag that I’m seeing in the feedback is deprioritizing the onboarding experience. I think that’s the meatiest part  of the testing. And testing if devices are unregistered, semi registered, or fully registered is a big factor in making this device feel integrated and magical from the very beginning of the brandlab. I’m not sure that the device will have as much impact if a facilitator just hands me a phone and tells me what to do with it. It’s the guest’s first impression of this companion piece and we want it to be a magical, fan-fucking-tastic one!
<http://i.imgur.com/YsbKHg1.gif?noredirect>
Thanks Sarah! I think that is a great point for discussion for them. Namely- where are there objections stemming from?
Yeah - I'm 100% with you. I've got a few red flags here
totally - there’s more than a few red flags in the details for sure

yea i’m getting the idea that gidge’s interests lie in putting more features in and not worrying about smoothy educating people or integrating them in the lab. whereas ours is more about supplementing the core experience (the workshop) in the most unobtrusive way possible. someone check me if they think that’s wrong.
That’s a good framing of it <@U1172PRDX>

one thing I want to keep in mind, and why i keep going “yeah yeah, whatever on the specific features” — 

_Broadly_ we’re talking about test plans here. What we believe should be tested _during a project_.
ah yes, good catch
so - i both want to get them to talk through whatever they are thinking about, we push back to say our piece. And we collectively say — hey wouldn’t it be great to do the project together?
that last part, i’ll work on BTW. :wink:

Sounds good! Pardon me if it this was implied in what you were just saying to, but I think we could do well with some measure of level-setting as well (e.g. How do you see the app in BrandLab?) because, as Justin mentioned, I feel the concept we have addresses a lot of the feedback (e.g. "Specific areas where app can solve a problem"=continuity of information, seamless integration into the day, flexibility; "unique, impactful moments"= hero video, Live Questions)
So it seems like _something_ is amiss
i think that you’re on point robb. where josh may have understood our intentions, maybe we just need to bring gidge up to speed.
it maps back to our first gidge meeting honestly, where i think we just need to reorient everyone back to the materials we’ve already set in place.
Agree <@U1172PRDX>
my read on Gidge is he’s an explorer who just wants to get his hands dirty
so it’ll take a bit of restating what we have in place, why we have it, etc.
